message:
i am searching now for free .Net CMS which fit my requirements 
1. no hidden fees 
2. easily maintainability 
3. easily extendability 
4. can apply responsive design 
i found the top CMSs are DotNetNuke and orchard , what do you think ? any recommendations

data.message: in my opinion UMBRACO is open source very easy and strong  CMS support everything that you think about
If I said ".Net CMS" from cmsaspnet.com would it be a bad answer? :)

i tried both and dotnetnuke is very limited and orchard is promise one .
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16313497/dotnetnuke-umbraco-or-orchard
http://vschart.com/compare/orchard-project/vs/dotnetnuke
http://w3techs.com/technologies/comparison/cm-dotnetnuke,cm-orchard

Umbraco (and other similar products) work on Freemium model and are really meant to be purchased. DotNetNuke is very old and bad investment IMHO (I did very little work on it in 2012 on legacy app and really hated it). Your only option is Orchard.

If you consider removing the "Free" criteria, Umbraco seems to be the preferred CMS for design agencies that have to work with a .NET CMS. If you stick to free and you want a .NET CMS just because you are a .NET guy and YAGNI (You Aint Gonna Need It) to actual CMS programming, get a proper CMS (the best ones are in PHP), and that might just be WordPress.

Orchard is good and has built-in workflow, but the lack of documentation and contributions is one of its cons. You can find many outdated plugins and all developers request another developer to update the plugin, and this is an issue in .NET community.
